newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada wholesale trade rises 0.3 pct in June.
newsitem.headline: Canada wholesale trade rises 0.3 pct in June.

text.p: Canada's wholesale trade rose 0.3 percent seasonally adjusted in June to C$21.14 billion, Statistics Canada said on Friday.
Sales, adj C$21.14 bln +0.3 pct +4.7 pct
Inventories, adj C$31.19 bln -0.3 pct +1.2 pct
Note - dollar figures are billions. Other figures are percentage changes.
A Reuter survey of economists had forecast a 0.8 percent month-on-month rise in June. Statscan also revised its figure for May sales to C$21.07 billion from C$21.11 billion.

Statistics Canada said sales have now risen for six consecutive months following a very flat 1995. Inventories fell for the third consecutive month, adjusting after having built up through the latter part of 1995.
The stock-to-sales ratio, at 1.48, decreased for the fifth consecutive month, it added.

Sales of metals, hardware, plumbing and heating equipment and supplies rose 1.8 percent and motor vehicles, parts and accessories climbed 1.3 percent, while computers and related equipment fell 7.2 percent.

Lumber and building materials sales dropped 3.5 percent, while inventories dropped for the third straight month. Statistics Canada attributed the sales fall mostly to the Canada-U.S. softwood lumber agreement, restricting duty-free Canadian exports. Sales dipped towards the end of June to avoid going over a quarterly quota.
